alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 11:56AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 1230 PM PDT... At 1155 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Cottonwood Visitor, or 14 miles northwest of Chiriaco Summit. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Visitor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
